Bool opcApplicationHeaderRead ( const char *  file,
ordObjectInfoP  info 
)

Use installed readers to parse the header of an application file.

Returns:
True if read successfully.
Parameters:
file Program object.
info pointer to info structure, filled in by this call.
Bool opcApplicationReaderInstall ( const char *  file  ) 

Install a reader for application programs.

Returns:
True if installed successfully.
Parameters:
file Program object.

)

Connect a bridge to a bus.

Returns:
The new connection.
Parameters:
bridge Bridge.
bus Bus.
portName Name of port.
isMaster True if the connection is a master, false if a slave.
addrLo Lower address bound.
addrHi Upper address bound.

const char *  name,
Uns32  addrBits,
const char *  portName,
optParamP  params 
)

Create a bus.

Returns:
The new bus.
Parameters:
module Parent module.
name New bus name.
addrBits Number of address bits.
portName Export the bus using this port name.
params List of parameters for the instance.
Bool opcBusRegionAsCallbacks ( optBusP  bus,
const char *  name,
optProcessorP  proc,
optPriv  privilege,
Addr  addrLo,
Addr  addrHi,
optMemReadFn  rcb,
optMemWriteFn  wcb,
void *  nativeMemory,
void *  userData 
)

Implement an address region as callbacks.

Returns:
True if successful.
Parameters:
bus Bus.
name Name for the region.
proc Optional processor context. If valid, only this processor will trigger the callback.
privilege Set the access privilege.
addrLo Low address.
addrHi High address.
rcb Function called to implement bus reads.
wcb Function called to implement bus writes.
nativeMemory User data.
userData User data.

Parameters:
file Path to control file.

Parameters:

name Name of root module (optional).
params Simulator control parameters.
void opcRootModuleOld ( optModuleP  mi  ) 

Destroy a root module instance.

Parameters:
mi Root module instance.
const char* opcSprintf ( const char *  fmt,
  ... 
)

Create a temporary formatted string. Note that there are a limited number of buffers so do not rely on the data persisting beyond the next use of this function.

Returns:
A temporary string containing the formatted text.

... varargs.
void opcTerminate ( void   )

void opcVLNVIter ( const char *  vlnvroot,
const char *  vendor,
const char *  library,
const char *  name,
const char *  version,
optModelType  type,
optFileFn  cb,
void *  userData 
)

Call the given function on all files that match the given VLNV.

Parameters:
vlnvroot Path or list of paths to root of directory(s) containing modelsT.
vendor Vendor directory e.g. yourcompany.com.
library Library directory e.g. processor.
name Name directory e.g. risc32.
version Version directory e.g. 1.0.
type Type of model.
cb Callback.
userData User data passed to callback.
const char* opcVLNVString ( const char *  vlnvroot,
const char *  vendor,
const char *  library,
const char *  name,
const char *  version,
optModelType  type,
Bool  reportErrors 
)

Synthesize a VLNV path string given the vendor, library, name and version of the library object you wish to load. If models are stored according to Imperas guidelines, this should successfully locate any model. If all arguments are plain strings, constructs a path such as 'vlnvroot/vendor/library/name/version/objtype', otherwise the following rules are used: If vlnvroot is null, the default installation path is used. vlnvroot may be a ':' (Linux) or ';' (Windows) separated list of paths.

Returns:
Null if no file is found, otherwise a file path.
Parameters:
vlnvroot Path or list of paths to root of directory(s) containing modelsT.
vendor Vendor directory e.g. yourcompany.com.
library Library directory e.g. processor.
name Name directory e.g. risc32.
version Version directory e.g. 1.0.
type Type of model.
reportErrors Print errors and ambiguities, otherwise quietly return null if fails.
